p: The process of biodiesel oxidation has been studied in the past. The process is undertaken in three phases, shown in Figure 1. In the initiation phase ( Figure 1a), carbonyl radicals are made after a proton in the alkyl chain of biodiesel is removed by an initiator ion, a metallic catalyst, thermal stress or light. Generally, chains with one or more unsaturated bonds can be more susceptible to this process [ 7, 8].
